intro: Gamochaeta spiciformis, commonly known as the spikeform false fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its flowering period occurs during the summer months, producing small, yellowish to brownish flowers. The species is known for its ability to thrive in arid environments, making it an important component of local ecosystems.
